topics.body:
"@SquiggyBomb":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d461ca6368723c4e540100#post_53d461ca6368723c4e540100
He used to not be terrible. The Dark Knight Returns still stands as one of the best Batman comics ever written, and Batman: Year One is nothing to sneeze at either. Hell, even the Sin City comics are fucking fantastic!

But then we have literally everything else he's ever done. Pretty much the only one of his shittier works I give a pass is The Spirit because it is fucking funny as fuck.

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/53d476ca63687224c7590200#post_53d476ca63687224c7590200
Had good intentions for the German people. You got to admit, there was a lot of injustice towards Germany after WW1. The Treaty of Versaille wasn't exactly a nice thing the "good guys" did to the Germans. Hitler also was against smoking, and ran a campaign to protect animal welfare.

The Art academy probably shouldn't have turned him down. Then history may have avoided such tragedy. However, with no Nazis to halt the Soviet advance towards the west, Stalin would've had his way.
topics.author: 4fde5cee945b700a970060fc
